description.narrative: The ultimate goal of this project is to reduce morbidity and mortality due to Coronavirus (COVID-19) and to interrupt the transmission of this virus. This project will increase community awareness on the prevention and spread of the COVID-19 disease, reduce panicking and disinformation caused by the spread of the COVID-19 disease, and ensuring the supply of basic resources such as face masks, food, and shelter to the poorest and the needy.

mailing-address.narrative: 4229 S. Mobile Cir Apt D Aurora, Colorado CO 80013 United States

title.narrative: Providing Food Rations to Starving Indian Families

description.narrative: SevaChild is responding to the coronavirus pandemic and lockdown in India by providing food rations to poor families in three cities in India. We have reached 507 families through early August and plan to reach hundreds more through 2020. A $20 donation will provide lentils, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, tea leaves, sugar, and essentials like masks and sanitary napkins for a family of five for five weeks.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 1300 24620 Fern Valley Road Idyllwild, CA 92549-1300 United States

description.narrative: In times of crisis, entrepreneurship rates surge as folks work to build sustainable livelihoods and support their local community. Hurricane Katrina and the 2008 financial crisis are past examples (The Data Center); COVID-19 is today. Fund 17 is growing our capacity to provide free advising, education, and loan assistance to more under-resourced entrepreneurs in New Orleans as they start and grow their businesses. *We have permission from featured beneficiaries to use their full real names.

mailing-address.narrative: 2533 Columbus St #101 New Orleans, LA 70119 United States

title.narrative: Health services for teen mothers impacted by COVID

description.narrative: In times of crisis, women and girls are often overlooked. During this pandemic, a steep rise in unplanned pregnancies & reproductive health concerns for millions of girls globally is anticipated. UN SDSN Youth will provide accessible and readily available health services, through direct and contextualized provision of nutrition packs and family planning tools, as well as educational materials. This will serve 100 young mothers each in five regions of the Philippines, ranging from ages 15 to 25.

organisation.narrative: Sustainable Development Solutions Network Youth - Philippines, Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: Room 334, UP School of Economics Roxas Avenue, UP Campus Quezon City, Metro Manila 1101 Philippines

description.narrative: Prevent the occurrence of domestic accidents with children from the peripheries of Brazil during the COVID-19 pandemic, informing mothers, fathers and guardians about how to avoid these accidents through an emergency Campaign. In this way, we will guarantee the safe development of children, reduce the overload of hospital beds due to hospitalizations of children who are victims of accidents, in addition to preventing families from being exposed to the virus in Brazilian hospitals.

mailing-address.narrative: Rua Machado Bitencourt, 361 - CJ. 1010 449 Sao Paulo 04.044-905 Brazil

description.narrative: Global Emergency Care has launched the Emergency Action Fund in response to the COVID-19 crisis. Now, more than ever, your support of GEC is critical. Our Emergency Care Practitioners (ECPs) are some of the only specialist emergency care providers in Uganda and are the most equipped to deal with the COVID-19 crisis there. They are on the front lines of this pandemic as it spreads across Uganda, and are the communities' best hope for triaging COVID-19 symptoms and providing quality patient care.

mailing-address.narrative: 419 N. Harvey Ave. Oak Park, IL 60302 United States

description.narrative: The first wave of the Covid-19 pandemic presented a harsh reminder on the need for protective and hygienic materials. Families and communities around the world especially in third world countries, and underserved communities in Nigeria are in dire need. HarryCares Foundation have been working on possible ways to help in alleviating these problems: Using a preventative approach, we will provide protective and hygienic materials, while educating the community on the importance of personal hygiene.

mailing-address.narrative: 1001 Queens Wharf Road Toronto, ON M5V 0J9 Canada

description.narrative: ShelterBox is a charity that delivers aid to families devastated by conflict or natural disaster, to give them durable shelter and the tools to rebuild communities. This could be a family-sized tent or it could be heavy duty tarpaulins, ropes and nails to create emergency shelters. COVID-19 has added immense further pressure to devastated communities. ShelterBox is 20 years old in 2020! The Rotary Club of Hitchin Tilehouse aims to raise 12,000, being the approximate cost of 20 Shelter Boxes.

mailing-address.narrative: 3 Mews court Rear of 22 Bancroft Hitchin SG5 1JW United Kingdom

description.narrative: 2020 has surely been a year that not many will forget easily. For the first time in a very long time the whole world has teamed up to fight the same battle: COVID-19. It has caused a lot of harm however we can look back at it and come up with three main takeaways: -The urge to invest in Science to investigate the disease and come up with a vaccine -Increase financial support for investigators to communicate their findings -The obligation and need to educate society to better battle this disease

organisation.narrative: Asociacion Apadrina la Ciencia (Association Sponsor Science)

mailing-address.narrative: C/ Pico Balaitus 44, portal 3, 4A Madrid, Madrid 28035 Spain

description.narrative: Lilipad plans to support the 500+ kids in our communities by providing crucial educational materials and hundreds of books to each of our libraries. - In Uganda, we will financially support local staff affected by COVID-19, hire a librarian to assist the kids in their education, and also provide WIFI access and computers. - In Germany, we will open a new library in one of Berlin's largest refugee shelters. - In Morocco, we seek to employ full-time librarians in both our locations.

mailing-address.narrative: Flughafenstr. 84 Berlin, Berlin 12049 Germany

description.narrative: The Covid-19 pandemic is affecting everyone globally and make everyone daily life a lot harder especially for the impoverish families in Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. Despite there is no lock down but many of them facing shortage of foods and they do not have much fund It made hard for the impoverished families since their employment have been cut and their children are sleeping hungry without food. At least 100 families that their incomes have been affected and needing our emergency support

title.narrative: Build a School Building for 300 Girls & Boys

description.narrative: Kaus-e-Kazah (Rainbow in Urdu) is a free education school for 300 underprivileged girls, boys and special children where we provide free tuition, books, shoes, uniforms and transportation. We have been scraping by since 2003 but due to the COVID pandemic our donations have dwindled further, threatening our institute's ability to pay school expenses. Our major expense is rent, we request you to rid us of this challenge and build our 300 girls & boys a school building.

organisation.narrative: Network for Human and Social Development (NHSD)

title.narrative: Virtual Careers Fair for 2000 Teenagers in Nigeria

description.narrative: Do you sometimes believe that you would have made far greater career progress if half of what you know today, you knew when you were a teenager? Teenagers the world over, more so in Africa, need such information today to stem the tide of youth unemployment and underemployment and you can actually make this happen for them. This is even much more important in the Covid-19 era and beyond because the world of work is drastically different from what it was before now. Help us address this issue

organisation.narrative: Save A Child Save A Nation Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: 17 Fakeye Str., Off Yusuf Jimoh Str. Obawole Ifako-Ijaye, Lagos 234 Nigeria

description.narrative: Brazil's still fighting against COVID-19, and during this time of pandemic, the government recommendation is to stay isolated. But what can you do if you can't afford to stay home and don't have the conditions to buy supplies to be protected? The "Lavatories in Favelas" is the solution that we've found to help this people to stay safe during the pandemic. We'll provide soap and water in strategic points of brazilian slums, reducing the chance of contamination in "Favelas".

title.narrative: Humanitarian Aid to Street Vendors in Otavalo

description.narrative: Otavalo has a rapidly increasing population of severely impoverished street vendors due to COVID-19, with many trying to support families on $2 - $3 per day. The Ayni Ecuador Foundation has begun serving this vulnerable population in terms of nutritional aid to support physical health, psychosocial support to maintain mental health, and vocational support to increase earning potential. However, we still need your help to continue to stabilize and empower this overlooked at-risk group of people.

mailing-address.narrative: Ricaurte 346 Salinas Otavalo, Imbabura 100450 Ecuador

title.narrative: Raising Awareness on Covid in Zambia

description.narrative: As the World continues to struggle with the challenge of Covid 19. Zambia faces the same challenge but with limited resources. As a result Covid 19 is but propaganda for many especially those in the rural and remote areas where accurate and reliable information on Covid 19. The proposed project will help dispel rumors and conflicting information and provide people with accurate information they can use to make informed decisions. In addition to raising awareness, the project will also provide

mailing-address.narrative: Room 426 NAPSA Building Mongu, Western 9 Zambia

title.narrative: Green Factories for Myanmar Refugees / IDPs

description.narrative: Due to international funding cuts, Myanmar (Kayin) refugees/ IDPs are living in extreme situation in the camps. Covid-19 associated reduction in job opportunities in Myanmar makes their future return plan uncertain. Luckily, Kayin State has countless Areca palm trees. If we can set a disposable Areca leaf plate factory, we can employ more than 100 refugee/ IDP families. With the profit from this factory, we can build houses for returnees and implement more income generation for refugees/ IDPs.

mailing-address.narrative: Karen Return & Reestablishment Committee (KRRC) General Saw Lar Pwe Road, Community Resource Centre Sone See Myaing, Su Ka La Township, Mya Waddy 000 000 Myanmar

title.narrative: Digital Tools for Girls in Rural Morocco

description.narrative: In remote, rural areas of Morocco, girls face many obstacles to access education, making illiteracy levels as high as 70%. The covid pandemic has brought about new challenges, as school closures forced girls back to their villages, unable to access any education due to not being able to afford devices or internet costs. Education For All (EFA) will equip rural girls with distance education tools so they can keep learning in these uncertain times and not lose their right to access an education.

mailing-address.narrative: Education For All Morocco 8/10 South Street Epsom, Surrey, KT18 7PF United Kingdom

description.narrative: SBP is responding to Hurricane Laura along the SW Louisiana and SE Texas coastline. In the face of COVID-19, SBP's team and volunteers will take necessary precautions to safely work in the areas affected. Your support will help impacted families recover more quickly and return to the safety of their homes. For $10 per month, we can provide protective equipment to 12 volunteers. For $25 per month, we can insulate 2 homes. For $50 per month, we can completely reframe a home.

organisation.narrative: The St. Bernard Project, Inc. DBA - SBP, Inc

mailing-address.narrative: 2645 Toulouse Street New Orleans, LA 70119 United States

title.narrative: Rotary 10 Virtual Marathon for Ballymena Charities

description.narrative: Members of THE ROTARY CLUB OF BALLYMENA , NORTHERN IRELAND are organising a sponsored Virtual marathon over the weekend of 18-20 September with the aim of raising much needed funds for four local charities whose essential work has been adversely impacted by Covid 19. Each Club member has been asked to arrange a team of 7/8 people who will undertake to complete 10000 steps. Through sponsorship and other donations, Rotarians are determined to help address the shortfall in funding.

mailing-address.narrative: Adair Arms Hotel 1-7 Ballymoney Road Ballymena, UK BT43 5BS United Kingdom

description.narrative: This project will provide funds to protect inmates in Nigerian correctional facilities from the COVID-19 virus & other diseases. Typically 50-100% over capacity, these facilities provide ample breeding ground for spread. Our project will provide masks, education, and sanitation equipment to prison inmates to protect them while incarcerated, as well as during transport to & from court to resolve their cases. Anchor Heritage's skill acquisition programs will continue once normal operations resume

mailing-address.narrative: 32 SAJI AYANGADE STR, BESIDE AJAO ESTATE GATE ANTHONY LAGOS, LAGOS 234-1 Nigeria

description.narrative: This Community Resilience Programme will build community resilience in the rapidly changing situation of rural Nepal as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The project will provide awareness on health and hygiene practices, the dangers of child/ women trafficking and alcohol abuse, domestic/family violence and promote sustainable agriculture as well as the importance of environmental protection.

title.narrative: BRING GIRLS BACK TO SCHOOL AFTER COVID-19 IN KENYA

description.narrative: This project will keep marginalized rural girls in school and support wages and stipends for teachers and support staff from January 2021 when schools reopen. Riley Orton Foundation will provide the girls with 3 nutritious meals a day, books, personal hygiene materials including free sanitary pads, school uniforms and all they need to grow and thrive. The project will also offer 10 scholarships to high school girls and life skills & reproductive health and rights education to 500 rural girls.

mailing-address.narrative: RILEY ORTON FOUNDATION P.O. BOX 7466 KISUMU 40100 Kenya

title.narrative: COVID-19 RECOVERY PLAN FOR TOUR GUIDES IN UGANDA

description.narrative: While the long term social-economic impact of COVID-19 remains unknown, Africa Sustainable Tourism Care Foundation is working on a recovery plan to engage local tourism service provider around Kibale National Park in western Uganda in alternative sustainable income-generating projects to replenish the supply of face masks and hand soaps in the region. Funds from the campaign will be used to purchase machines and materials to make face masks and hand soaps.

description.narrative: The Covid-19 has spread fearlessly in Italy and Specchio dei tempi has actively helped by donating machineries and equipment to hospitals, delivering groceries to the elderly and single moms, donating tablets to keep the children in school & giving out sanitizing kits to the structures. Right now we are focusing on helping Venetian small business by launching a tender and help them get back on track. Help us obstructing Covid-19 and suppor those in need.

title.narrative: Empower and protect Dalit girls during lockdown

description.narrative: COVID-19 is having a major impact on the lives of Dalit girls in Bangladesh. Schools are closed, families are poorer and girls are isolated from protection services. They are missing out on their education, don't have access to hygiene products and, hidden behind closed doors, are victims of violence and child marriage. We teach girls to produce their own face masks and sanitary pads and empower them to go back to school. Together we make girls visible and safe again.

mailing-address.narrative: Hooglandse Kerkgracht 17 F Leiden 2312 HS Netherlands

description.narrative: Across the Middle East, universities and study centers in refugee camps have closed due to Covid-19. In Jordan, refugees and underserved youth are struggling to deal with the unexpected shocks of the pandemic. Education is a basic need, promoting self-reliance and the skills to build a future. Yet, refugees are more alienated than ever before. With your support, Kiron can ensure that refugees and underserved communities receive access to high-quality online education, tailored to their needs.

mailing-address.narrative: Herzbergstrae 82-84 Berlin, Berlin 10365 Germany

title.narrative: COVID 19 screening, preventing control in SA KIDS

Children are facing being killed ,raped and abuse and now has to face another unseen enemy COVID 19.They are afraid, some lost family members. are alone, are hungry, have questions but are to scared to ask. Help OMEGA CENTRE TO SAVE KIDS LIVES by continuing to screen, to prevent, to show, and to inform our future adults,

title.narrative: Combat Corona to the Last Mile In Kenya

description.narrative: In Kenya, most people live from hand to mouth, with 40% of the people living below the poverty line and 50% just above it. For our community, staying home makes it difficult to get necessities like soap, food, and salt. This project is acting in response to the COVID outbreak or its consequences, through raising awareness about prevention, supporting vulnerable populations during the economic stop-down. MCDC plans to support 200 households to access ,food ,shelter,education and healthcare .

title.narrative: Provide Reusable Sanitary Pads for 2000 Teenagers.

description.narrative: The project will supply reusable sanitary pads to 2000 teenage girls, train 100 teenage girls on making reusable sanitary pads and provide them with knowledge on sexuality education, which will enable them improve their hygiene, reduce risks of sexually transmitted infection, unplanned pregnancy and unsafe abortion in Kenya. These girls have adversely been affected by covid-19 pandemic since the first case was reported in Kenya.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. BOX 102 MUMIAS, KAKAMEGA 50102 Kenya

title.narrative: Covid-19 Treatment for Frontline Health Workers

description.narrative: PHASE Nepal works in remote and isolated areas of Nepal supporting free primary health care, livelihood and education improvement, supporting PWDs, disaster risk reduction, research and now Covid-19 response. PHASE Nepal provides direct health services to more than 90,000 patients/year in remote Humla, Mugu, Bajura, Sindhupalchok and Gorkha. Thus, this project aims to save lives of health workers and community workers by supporting their treatment incase of possible infection & complication.

title.narrative: Support 180 households to live after Covid -19

description.narrative: After the death of the villagers of Covid -19, 3 villages live in panic, no longer know how to go to pick mushrooms and collect woody forest products in the forest savannah; family is on alert and lack of foods, their situation is worsened by Covid -19. A micro agricultural production project will help them to live with the protection measures against the pandemic and to rebuild their survival on 120 hectares, including 90 ha of maize in the rainy season and 30 ha of gardens in the dry season.

title.narrative: Build classrooms for 200 students in rural Togo

The classrooms will also be equipped with locally manufactured school benches to enable 200 primary school students to learn in a safe and adequate environment. Finally, face masks and hand washing systems will be provided in the classrooms to protect the students from COVID-19 infections.

description.narrative: NITC will install tree ceilings in Title1 schools in Latino communities in East LA. COVID-19 has disproportionally affected this population, traumatizing its children. Mental health experts have voiced concern over mitigating anxiety in these children as they return to school. Research shows tree images help students settle down, engage and focus. In our pilot study, students report that tree ceilings make them happy and are the reason they like coming to school. Endorsed by TREE Foundation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 2589 Avalon, CA 90704 United States

title.narrative: Saving Lives of NHS Operating Theatre Staff, Essex

description.narrative: The Covid 19 pandemic has put the safety of theatre staff at risk and caused essential operations to be cancelled. The Airseal System is essential in order for Surgeons to continue offering Keyhole surgery (laparoscopic and robotic) at Broomfield Hospital, Chelmsford, Essex during the Covid19 pandemic and beyond. The Keyhole surgery programme at Broomfield Hospital is intended to be expanded and the number of Keyhole operations increased in the future.

The virus could affect everyone; however, evidence suggests that older forks and people with underlying conditions are at greater risk. And to protect those people at risk, funding is required to put measures in place so that the spread of this novel pandemic should promptly be minimized in our community.

With the materials provided they will be able to continue their studies, avoiding a complete cut-off from the education system that would otherwise happen. In addition, these children will be provided with sanitation packages to reduce the risk of infection and transmission of COVID-19.

description.narrative: As the children in Haiti are resuming school amid the Covid-19, the most pressing action for the organisation "LIGHT" is secure them against a potential spread of the virus through our existing medical platform. This project aims at building the capacity of teachers and students on preventive measures to adopt against the virus and Implementing in schools a warning system for suspicious cases through our app. phone called, Virtual Medical Assistance Center (VMAC).

Your donation will allow the poorest people in Chile to have access to protection elements against the virus to prevent them from being infected and for childrens from these families without income to have food to continue developing in a healthy way even despite the effects of the virus. title.narrative: Connect poor preschoolers to books in Tucuman

Maxi lives in Tucuman, one of the poorest regions in Argentina. Together, we can help Maxi and his community beat the odds, by creating home libraries for 60 preschoolers like him and giving parents tools as their child's first and most important teacher.

mailing-address.narrative: Maipu 452 San Miguel de Tucuman, Tucuman 4000 Argentina

title.narrative: HOME BASED CARE TO ELDERLY IN KENYA ON COVID 19

description.narrative: This project will build a day care center in Western parts of Kenya, providing rich comprehensive care to the elderly with compromised immune systems that are susceptible to the effects of Covid 19 and Life limited diseases. The pandemic has brought great confusion that elderly are neglected while services and crucial services are geared towards the productive members of the society. This project will improve health of 700 elders and reunite them with their families with sustainable programs.

mailing-address.narrative: 858 Kakamega 50100 Kenya

title.narrative: Medical Kit for 700 Children living in Cemetery

description.narrative: 700s of children between 1 and 14 are living in the Pasay City Cemetery. Children are exposed to disease with a lot of dirt and rotting water from the cemetery. They got a small wound and skin disease of unknown cause. Without getting the right treatment, they just leave it until the wound and disease get better. Under this project, 700 poor children will be given medical kits (Vitamin, Wound ointment, Bandage, etc), health check-up, hospital treatment and antibacterial mask (Facing Covid-19).

description.narrative: COVID-19 hit the restaurant industry in Vietnam hard. With lockdown and no international tourists, we sadly had to close the doors to KOTO Training Restaurant at 59 Van Mieu. However, we're going to come back stronger than ever. We're fundraising to purchase much-needed items for our new restaurant. The KOTO restaurant is the training grounds for our trainees. It's here that they make mistakes, learn to work with one another, develop new cooking techniques and practice their customer service.

mailing-address.narrative: 59 Van Mieu St Dong Da District Ha Noi 100123 Vietnam

title.narrative: Help Needy in Remote Villages in India Fight COVID

description.narrative: The impact of COVID-19 in India has been highly disruptive, destroying both lives and livelihoods. As we adapt to these unprecedented circumstances, Educate Girls is continuing to serve the most marginalized and vulnerable communities who have been disproportionately affected with the loss of livelihoods, lack of food, poor access to health facilities, sub-optimal education and other basic needs. We were able to impact 500k people and 250k children last year through this. Need is much more now!

title.narrative: Help US Send 220 Children To School in Haiti

description.narrative: The goal of Home Roots Foundation is to remove money as a barrier to receiving an education in Haiti with your help. Recent political unrest followed by the COVID-19 pandemic has made a bad situation dreadful. School directors have lamented that students are staying home because of inability to pay. With your help, we can pay tuition, fees, and uniforms for students. We can also provide books, pens, backpacks, tutoring and hope.

There is a long road to recovery, and much to do improve Utila for the future. Your help is needed. Please help us expedite securing the resources needed to keep the people, pets and environment of Utila safe, strong and healthy.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency: Prevent Return to Child Labour

description.narrative: Emergency funding is needed to prevent children returning to child labour. ACE (1997) withdraws children from hazardous labour in the cotton fields of Telangana, India, so that they can receive a quality education, enjoy their childhood and secure their independence. Due to the global pandemic, schools and vocational training centres are closed. We are offering the most vulnerable families with financial support and children with home educational materials and food, to safeguard their future.

These scholarships will allow beneficiaries to focus on their project rather than doing odd jobs to survive.

They will be educated about COVID-19 and the best way to protect themselves and their family from disease. description.narrative: Imagine battling child malnutrition without any hope of a helping hand to prevent early death! Unfortunately, this is the story of over 2 million children in Uganda. The situation is even dire with COVID-19. As Child and Family Foundation Uganda, working with community health workers and peer mothers, we seek your donation to identify 600 malnourished children this year and provide them with healthcare and nutrition support to restore healthy growth and prevent death. title.narrative: Supporting Single Mothers affected from COVID-19

description.narrative: In light of Egyptian Food Bank's efforts to fight hunger & as a second stage for supporting day labor;EFB has decided to provide feeding boxes to the underprivileged COVID-19 cases,especially Single Moms who lost their jobs &income,by giving them Healthy Nutritious food boxes enough for their families,till they are back to their jobs.The main objective of this initiative is providing main &sufficient nutrition for mothers that have been negatively impacted due to the COVID-19 continuous spread.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 44-Beside New Cairo Hospital , Third Settlement,Cairo Cairo 11835 Egypt

description.narrative: This project aims to assist 7,000 vulnerable children and youth without family care or at risk of losing it, also assisting families who depend on our support, affected by COVID 19 pandemic. We would cover the basic needs in terms of food, hygiene, psychosocial and educational support at 5 provinces in Argentina: Lujan, Rosario, Mar del Plata, Cordoba and Obera.

mailing-address.narrative: Moreno 1850 5th floor Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires C1094ABB Argentina

title.narrative: Create a turning point for 50 Ugandan students

description.narrative: The Africa Students Support Network (AFRISSUN) uses Entrepreneurial Leadership (EL) education and seed capital investments to enable 50 struggling part-time student workers in Central Uganda to attend school by assisting them to start legal and manageable side-businesses to generate extra income. With the COVID-19 workplace changes, we even need to work more closely with students to mitigate potential financial indifferences to a bright future because the jobs students used to do are no more.

mailing-address.narrative: Kampala Kampala, Kampala 00000 Uganda

title.narrative: Covid Can't Win! Help Support Families & Survivors

description.narrative: Trapped! Our Modern Day Prison! COVID-19 has destroyed countless lives globally & thrust millions into poverty & needless suffering. In its midst, The Covid Can't Project & iNYLAC's fight for survivors, reminds us that Together, We're Stronger Than any Obstacle! Together we provide Masks, Supplies & Encouragement nationally to those hardest hit! Helping Survivors Break Chains & Inspiring Global Leaders, proving that Social Distancing is Not Social Isolation! We're in this Together & We Will Win!

organisation.narrative: True Help & Empowerment for Women & Aspiring Youth Foundation USA

mailing-address.narrative: 9203 Hwy 6 South, Suite #124-236 Houston, TX 77083 United States

title.narrative: Provide Essential Lab Services for Pregnant Women

description.narrative: We provide essential lab services for pregnant and birthing women. Currently, our lab can't offer vaginal swab tests for STDs or WBC (White Blood Cell) tests, as we need replacement equipment parts. We can't offer HIV tests as we currently lack the lab reagent. We are required to test labouring Moms for HIV to protect babies and staff. We urgently need more COVID-19 rapid tests. Under federal law, we can't accept a labouring Mom as a patient unless she has a negative COVID19 test.

organisation.narrative: Yayasan Bumi Sehat, Ds. PKR Nyuh Kuning

mailing-address.narrative: Jalan Nyuh Bulan Nyuh Kuning Gianyar, Gianyar 80571 Indonesia

title.narrative: Covid Relief for Special Needs Families

description.narrative: Our Mobile inClusion Relief Center will travel through Los Angeles County. Due to COVID-19, thousands of families are under served and at high risk for infection, sickness, neglect, abuse and malnutrition. Our Mobile Center will provide a safe space where we provide relief to families in areas such as education, food, supplies, support groups, sensory activities, behavioral services and life and social skills while maintaining physical distance.

mailing-address.narrative: 21781 Ventura Blvd PMB 23376 Woodland Hills, CA 91364 United States

title.narrative: Preventing infection in mothers & babies in Uganda

description.narrative: Essential hand sanitiser, scrubs and specialist training enable health workers to combat infectious diseases, including COVID-19. Infections cause 20% of maternal mortality in our partner hospitals in Kampala where around 30,000 births take place every year. This project helps mothers and babies stay healthy and prevents deaths. We need your support to maintain our established hand sanitiser production and dispensing at the hospitals, local procurement of scrubs and infection training for staff.

mailing-address.narrative: Box 126 Addenbrooke's Hospital, Hills Road Cambridge, Cambridgeshire CB2 0QQ United Kingdom

title.narrative: COVID-19 relief help for the undeserved in Uganda

description.narrative: In contemporary times, the world has never been affected by a catastrophic pandemic disease like the one it is facing now. Covid-19 has affected almost every country in the world and it's still spreading. Your donation will help cope up with the disease challenges in the helpless communities of Uganda in the following ways; It will help to send doctors, nurses, and other front line responders to refugees' camps and remote areas. It will help buy masks, ventilators, and other lifesaving medicals

organisation.narrative: Friends for Human Survival and Development limited

mailing-address.narrative: Makerere Hill road, Kampala, Uganda Kampala 00256 Uganda

title.narrative: Digital education for Syrian refugee children

description.narrative: In 10 years, 90% of jobs will require digital skills. Syrian refugee children have limited to no possibility to acquire these skills. TSF provides them with a welcoming environment to learn digital skills in an engaging way. No matter what their background is, children can start learning from day one and building the blocks of a brighter future. With COVID-19 significantly hampering educational opportunities, this solution allows Syrian refugee children to continue their learning even remotely.

mailing-address.narrative: 19 Rue Jean Baptiste Carreau Pau, Nouvelle-Aquitaine 64000 France

title.narrative: Help St Martins School Open its doors in 2021

description.narrative: Covid-19 is having a severe impact on the pupils of St Martin's school in Kibagare slum, and area already enduring widespread suffering. The school is a sanctuary for over 1000 children from Kibagare providing not just a place of education but a safe space for them from the hardships of their daily lives. St Martin's is a space where the children can be children and at the same time receive regular meals, kindness and care. Now Covid-19 is threatening the existence of our school.

mailing-address.narrative: KITISURU DIVISION,MUKABI ROAD,LORESHO ESTATE 68291 Westlands, Nairobi 00200 Kenya

title.narrative: Install 20 water cisterns in rural Puerto Rico

description.narrative: Water is life! Access to clean water in rural Puerto Rico is unstable due to constant power outages, exacerbated since Hurricane Maria in 2017. In this new context of COVID-19, combined with non-stop earthquakes and a hyperactive hurricane season, water becomes essential to the very survival of those that are at a higher risk when low hygiene conditions are present. We look to provide the means for some of the most vulnerable families to have access to water during service shutdowns.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 328 Hormigueros 00660 Puerto Rico

title.narrative: Buy a Brick - Build a new HOME

description.narrative: COVID-19 hit the restaurant industry in Vietnam hard. With lockdown and no international tourists, we sadly had to close KOTO Training Restaurant at 59 Van Mieu. Since the future of the tourism industry hangs in the balance, it's not a viable strategy for KOTO to "sit and wait it out". We hope you consider supporting KOTO by being one of the first to "Buy a Brick - Build a new HOME" for our new restaurant, all funds will go towards building KOTO Villa which will be a new home for the trainees.

mailing-address.narrative: 59 Van Mieu St Dong Da District Ha Noi 100123 Vietnam

title.narrative: Build Sustainability Skills of Ten African Leaders

description.narrative: COVID-19 has wreaked havoc across Africa both in terms of health and the economy. Many economic development plans are being created by governments and private entities to re-build the same type of systems that provided the opportunity for a pandemic to flourish. Through training, information and networking on impact assessment techniques, this project will build the expertise in ten local leaders to respond to community needs and foster sustainable development.

mailing-address.narrative: 1330 23rd St S Ste C Fargo, ND 58103 United States

description.narrative: Help our teachers as they engage our 400+ students in this new school year - whether it be in-person classes or distance learning. Children growing up in Vietnamese orphanages face isolation. The past 6+ months of the covid19 pandemic has heightened this isolationism as many orphanages have locked their gates, limiting contact with Kidspire staff. These teachers aren't just providing a S.T.E.A.M. focused learning program. They offer much needed: Encouragement. Motivation. Confidence. Hope.

mailing-address.narrative: 3300 NW 185th, #127 Portland, OR 97229 United States

description.narrative: Tahanan ng Pagmamahal Children's Home, Inc wants to sustain the basic needs of the 45 children including food and medical to boost their immune system and to prevent them from COVID 19 Pandemic and other illnesses.

organisation.narrative: Tahanan ng Pagmamahal Children's Home, Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: #45 Dr. Pilapil Street, Barangay Sagad Pasig City 1600 Philippines

title.narrative: COVID-19 Palliative for 1200 households in Nigeria

description.narrative: This project will cushion the impact of economic hardship, hunger, and poverty on 1,200 households in selected rural agrarian communities in Osun State, Nigeria that are impacted by COVID-19. The benefiting households from the selected communities of Inisa, Eko-Ende, Aagba, Iree, Ada, and Igbajo will receive raw staple food materials of 10 kg each of Rice, Beans, and Gari each to alleviate their economic situation.

mailing-address.narrative: 3654 Sw 163rd Ave Miramar. Florida 33027 Miramar, FL 33027 United States

title.narrative: Help Save Lives with Team Survive

description.narrative: Team Survive, a PCI Media initiative, tells stories that educate people about COVID-19 to keep themselves and their communities safe. These stories address COVID-19 health practices, ways that essential workers can stay safe, and how to cope with the emotional fallout of the pandemic. We understand the power of using the right platform to reach the right audience.

mailing-address.narrative: 26 Broadway Suite 934 New York, New York 10004 United States

title.narrative: Donate Health To 50 Low-Income Colombian Children

description.narrative: During the Covid-19 pandemic, many children with disabilities and polydiagnosis have stopped receiving medical care. In Colombia, state resources have been prioritized to face the current health crisis, leaving in second place the needs of medical and specialized care of the population with disabilities or high-cost illnesses. Our Foundation supports this population through specialized consultations, medications, and therapies that helps to improve the physical and mental health of children

mailing-address.narrative: Carrera 50 # 52 - 22 Edificio Bermora of 605 Medellin, Antioquia 00000 Colombia

title.narrative: JAC's COVID Conversion For Its ReEntry Clinics!

description.narrative: JAC first went virtual to provide our legal services to people with criminal records during COVID-19, but found that lack of internet and cell phone access were barriers for many. We then took the clinic outside. Now, with vaccinations up and the weather too hot to operate outside, we are moving back inside. Your support will help us secure adequate PEP, space to socially distance, technology for paperless sign in, and other adjustments necessary to provide our services as safely as possible!

organisation.narrative: Justice and Accountability Center of Louisiana

mailing-address.narrative: 4035 Washington Avenue Suite 203 New Orleans, LA 70125 United States

title.narrative: Improve Housing Conditions for Cancer Patients

description.narrative: To improve our housing conditions include bigger bathrooms, more space in the dinning room to guarantee physical distancing of at least 1 meter, portable sinks in different spots for frequent hand-washing or disinfection, provide medical masks to everyone at the house, disposable gowns and gloves for the nurses to wear. All this key measure expenses to protect against Covid 19 weren't part of our 2020 budget, and since we paused our fundraising events this year, we are cash flow constrained.

mailing-address.narrative: Calle 49 # 65- 09 Barranquilla 00000 Colombia

title.narrative: Help families affected by COVID-19 in the DR

description.narrative: The Project is an initiative of the Joyas de Cristo Boys and Girls Foundation and sponsored by the Funcomas Foundation that seeks to save the lives of thousands of hundreds of families that are being affected by the current crisis caused by COVID-19. This project gives you the opportunity to help guarantee food, health and education for affected people and their direct dependents. As well as dependents of people who have been unemployed due to the pandemic.

organisation.narrative: Community Foundation in Favor of Single Mothers and Young Unprotected Funcomas RNC. 430024882

mailing-address.narrative: C / Manresa Altagracia # 14 National District Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional 11107 Dominican Republic

title.narrative: Computers for Children`s Crisis Shelter in Ukraine

description.narrative: Six computers will be provided for classroom of Children's Center for Rehabilitation and Social Adaptation. Children aged 7 - 18 years from poor and crisis families are living at a Center`s social dormitory in Odesa, Ukraine, fully supported by the Way Home Foundation. Your donation will help the them to get access to school distance education during the COVID-19 epidemic. In addition, they will learn computer literacy and coding basics. More than 50 children a year will benefit.

mailing-address.narrative: Sofiivska str. 10 Odessa 65082 Ukraine

title.narrative: To Prevent spread and mitigate impact of COVID-19

description.narrative: Bamenda is a densely populated and conflict-prone area and a host to more than 25000 IDPs, and pre-existing vulnerabilities that are likely to be exacerbated by the pandemic. IDPs and vulnerable families may not be able to feed and provide basic needs for their children and families in the coming weeks. Within this context SUDAHSER is implementing a project with objective to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and mitigate the socio-economic impact for vulnerable and conflict affected communities

organisation.narrative: Sustainable development and Humanitarian services (SUDAHSER) Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Bamenda Mile four Nkwen Bamenda, NW Region 216 Cameroon

title.narrative: Family Autism Center Support During Covid & Beyond

description.narrative: During these challenging times, The Family Autism Center remains committed to supporting individuals and their families either remotely or in socially distant settings, providing advocacy, supports and services; navigating DDS, Mass Health, ABA), recreational and social activities for children and adults, support groups for parents and grandparents, workshops and trainings such as IEP training and financial planning, ABA/Behavioral Interventions, Basic Rights and informational resources.

mailing-address.narrative: 789 Clapboardtree Street Westwood, MA 02090 United States

title.narrative: Providing food baskets to students in Mozambique

description.narrative: This project will provide monthly food baskets to vulnerable schoolchildren and their families across six rural villages in Mozambique. Schools are closed due to COVID-19 and students are no longer able to depend on daily school lunches. To prevent these children from going hungry at home, the Mozambique School Lunch Initiative is providing monthly food baskets to over 1,000 children and their families, stocked with key staples and fresh produce purchased from local farmers.

mailing-address.narrative: 5105 S PARK LANE SPOKANE, WA 99223 United States

title.narrative: Support the completion of Mkanthama school block

description.narrative: Mkanthama is one of the poorest rural communities in Lilongwe where access to education for children is very hard to find. The next school close to where our school project is situated is about 3 Kilometres away which is very difficult for children to walk to. In 2017 we started this school project so that children in this area can also have the opportunity to go to school and learn. Due to the closure of schools because of Covid-19 we started constructing a school block which has 3 classrooms.

mailing-address.narrative: P.o Box X191 Lilongwe X191 Malawi

title.narrative: Musical Resilience 4 At-Risk Youth During COVID-19

description.narrative: Students in continuation high schools in high-poverty neighborhoods in Los Angeles Unified struggle with hunger, housing insecurity, vulnerability to COVID-19, and the daily strain of racism and economic hardship. Removed from their main high schools due to academic decline, now in Continuation Schools, they can receive supports to graduate on time. This project gives them a guitar and supplies for learning the songs and history of music for social justice in a grant-funded GITC pilot program!

mailing-address.narrative: 1286 University Ave #389 San Diego, CA 92103 United States

title.narrative: 150 h/holds with Water access for COVID Prevention

description.narrative: This water pan project will increase the availability of clean water to at-least 1600 direct beneficiaries in Kitui County . The project aims at ensuring that community member have reliable,safe and clean water even in the toughest climatic moments.The project goal is promote youth and women empowerment through hygiene interventions and vegetable production increasing availability and affordability.

mailing-address.narrative: Box 901-90200 email address kidc@nbnet.co.ke or kidc@kituidevcentre.org KITUI 90200 Kenya

title.narrative: Project Legacy Kid's Club & Scholarship Program

description.narrative: Project Legacy is our children's education and scholarship program reaching at-risk children and youth. Marginalized children are in need of scholarships due to lack of household income to pay monthly and enrollment school fees, supplies, uniforms, etc.. Due to COVID, an online study room has been set up to accommodate children without access to wifi and assistance with homework. The after-school program includes a healthy snack, games, quality story-time and necessary life skills training.

organisation.narrative: Yayasan Transformasi Komunitas Indonesia (a.k.a) Indonesia Aid

mailing-address.narrative: Jl. Gn. Soputan No. 99XX,Perumahan Lady Garden No. 3A Pemecutan Klod, West Denpasar, Denpasar Bali 80119 Indonesia

title.narrative: Tidal Wave of Poverty in the Himalayas

description.narrative: A tidal wave of poverty is sweeping across South Asia as a result of COVID-19. The Himalayan country NEPAL is particularly hard hit, as literally millions of migrant workers across South Asia have lost income and livelihood due to continued lockdowns. Himalayan Life has set out to meet this need through providing relief to families and communities in Nepal.

mailing-address.narrative: Bahnhofstrasse 267 Wetzikon 8623 Switzerland

title.narrative: Sponsor Runners to Help Orphans in Japan 2020

description.narrative: Join us virtually this Boxing Day to raise awareness and funds for children living in orphanages in Japan. COVID 19 has raised the awareness of our health and fitness at the same time has limited our ability to connect face to face. This year FocusCore Group has organized a virtual marathon day where we can all be connected, get fit and give back. Join us December 26,2020.

mailing-address.narrative: 2-8-6 Matsugaoka Trinite B 103 Nakano-ku, Tokyo 165-0024 Japan

title.narrative: Support Children in Albania post COVID-19

description.narrative: From the needs assessment for the COVID-19 situation conducted by Save the Children Albania, the data show that 70% of respondents stated that they do not have the financial means to provide protective equipment and hygiene to protect themselves from COVID-19. The project will provide support with hygienic packages for families and especially for children.

mailing-address.narrative: Lagja: 28 Nentori Rruga: Mefail Bicaku Elbasan, Albania 3001 Albania

title.narrative: Ayni Relief Fund for Indigenous Peoples of Peru

description.narrative: Peru has been decimated by Covid-19. This project will help the indigenous community of Chincero recover in several ways. Over 80% of their economy has come from traditional textile weaving, but markets have disappeared due to the pandemic. Tourism-dependent families are starving, elders and children are at risk. The Ayni project revives traditional agricultural methods to provide food, help bring technology to children for education and protect the elders and traditional teaching and wisdom.

mailing-address.narrative: 1123 Broadway Ste 913 New York, NY 10010 United States

description.narrative: Like everywhere, 2020/2021 has been very challenging in Zanzibar. However, it's because of the generosity of our donors that we have been able to quickly adjust our plans and continue supporting our communities and local teams through expanding our activities and setting up COVID-19 relief projects. This fund will allow our education, health and conservation programs in Zanzibar to restart when health recommendations, government regulations, and community situations allow us to do us.

mailing-address.narrative: 153 Main Road Muizenberg, Western Cape 7945 South Africa

description.narrative: Like everywhere, 2020/2021 has been very challenging in Moshi, Tanzania. However, it's because of the generosity of our donors that we have been able to quickly adjust our plans and continue supporting our communities and local teams through expanding our activities and setting up COVID-19 relief projects. This fund will allow our gender equality, health and empowerment programs in Moshi to restart when health recommendations, government regulations, and community situations allow us to do us.

It's because of the generosity of our donors that we have been able to quickly adjust our plans and continue supporting our communities and local teams through expanding our activities and setting up COVID-19 relief projects. This fund will allow our education, healthcare and empowerment programs in St.Lucia to restart when health recommendations, government regulations, and community situations allow us to do us.

description.narrative: Like everywhere, 2020/2021 has been very challenging in Cape Town. It's because of the generosity of our donors that we have been able to quickly adjust our plans and continue supporting our communities and local teams through expanding our activities and setting up COVID-19 relief projects. This fund will allow our education, gender equality and empowerment programs in Cape Town to restart when health recommendations, government regulations, and community situations allow us to do us.

mailing-address.narrative: 153 Main Road Muizenberg, Western Cape 7945 South Africa

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic poses unprecedented challenges globally. In addition to widespread loss of life, the virus is overwhelming health systems, eroding livelihoods, and devastating economies. These impacts disproportionately affect people living in poverty. BRAC has leveraged our network of 50,000 frontline staff and volunteers by sharing public health information, providing emergency supplies like food and water, assembling handwashing stations in public spaces, and distributing cash support.

mailing-address.narrative: 110 William Street, 29th Floor New York, NY 10038 United States

title.narrative: Keep 100 students affected by Covid-19 in school.

description.narrative: This project will support 100 school going children who have been forced to drop out of school because their parents or guardians have lost their sources of income due to Covid-19 . The project will provide school fees, school uniform, books and free meals to help them stay in school.

mailing-address.narrative: KIBERA DRIVE KIBERA DRIVE NAIROBI, KENYA 8156-00200 Kenya

title.narrative: Help Bangladeshi Flood Victims During the Pandemic

description.narrative: Bangladesh is facing its worst floods in a decade, and coupled with the COVID-19 pandemic and Cyclone Amphan - the strongest in 30 years, they are devastating the remote, northern river islands of the country. Friendship NGO's comprehensive disaster preparedness and management interventions are fighting to preserve the lives, livelihoods and lifestyles of those affected, stemming from years of experience in the field doing the same. However, support is needed, given the enormity of the task.

mailing-address.narrative: K-14/2A Baridhara North Road Kalachandpur Dhaka 1212 Bangladesh

description.narrative: The Community COVID Housing Program (CCHP) is a transformative plan that will rebuild the lives of 5,000 people over the next 2 years. The CCHP will focus on multiple strategies including Housing, Diversion and Mental Health Case Management. This program will permanently house people who are currently experiencing literal homelessness (e.g., living in shelters, encampments or on the streets) as well as those who may fall into homelessness as a result of the economic effects of the coronavirus.

organisation.narrative: Coalition for the Homeless of Houston/Harris County

mailing-address.narrative: 2000 Crawford, Suite 700 Houston, TX 77002 United States

title.narrative: Build classrooms for 200 students in rural Togo

description.narrative: This project will build three basic classrooms in improved "apatam" style in the village of Dafolenyame in southern Togo. The classrooms will also be equipped with locally manufactured school benches to enable 200 primary school students to learn in a safe and adequate environment. Finally, face masks and hand washing systems will be provided in the classrooms to protect the students from COVID-19 infections.

organisation.narrative: Synergie d'Actions pour un Developpement Approprie (SADA)

mailing-address.narrative: Apedokoe Lome 07 BP 12354 Togo

title.narrative: Support Internally Displaced Persons in Cameroon

description.narrative: Four years into the Anglophone Crisis coupled with the COVID-19 pandemic, hundreds have been recorded dead, over a thousand homes burned and over 900,000 people have fled their homes. This has led to a fragmented health care system, primary school education, suboptimal water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) Food insecurity and high rate of malnutrition. CAMAAY is working with several local communities affected by the crisis to ensure that Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) are supported.

mailing-address.narrative: Manchock Street, Oku, PO Box 905 Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon Cameroon

title.narrative: Wise Climate Change Action Using Impact Assessment

description.narrative: Greater involvement of impact assessment (IA) specialists is vital to making smart global COVID-19 recovery and climate change choices. They have the expertise to provide oversight for the worldwide infrastructure transition to achieve a net zero carbon target in 30 years. Through this project, IA specialists will provide expertise to banks, insurance firms, attorney organizations, journalists, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and the Arctic Council.

mailing-address.narrative: 1330 23rd St S Ste C Fargo, ND 58103 United States

description.narrative: To empower vulnerable and disadvantaged women and children in remote villages to learn to protect and care for themselves as they face the COVID-19 pandemic, thereby increasing local self-reliance and sustainable food production. It is 6 months project actual starting date will depend on fundraising through GlobalGiving 6 months period. Total expected Number of Participants 200 Vulnerable women and Children. Requested budget $5,000.

mailing-address.narrative: HCCB 6-C Jahanara Monjil 24 West Senpara Parbota Mirpur Dhaka Same as above Dhaka 1216 Bangladesh

title.narrative: Educate Over 45 Disadvantaged Children in Greece

description.narrative: Our project aims to support over 45 disadvantaged children and youths in Crete, Greece in receiving an education. Refugee children confront huge obstacles and challenges to receive the education and support they need to have a better future and find employment. COVID-19 is making it even harder. We provide in person and online practical assistance and lessons preparing children for a brighter future, work and better integration. We need your donation to insure urgent and impactful support!

mailing-address.narrative: Via dei Gracchi 297 Rome 00192 Italy

description.narrative: Every woman and girl has the right to determine her own sexuality, reproductive health, and future. That's why Ipas, as part of the broader reproductive justice movement, works to ensure that governments recognize abortion as an essential health service-and that all people have access. During the COVID-19 pandemic, your support helps us train abortion providers, ensure women have the information they need to access abortion, and educate young people on sexual and reproductive health and rights.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 9990 Chapel Hill, NC 27515 United States

title.narrative: Provide Rehabilitative Care in Haiti During COVID

description.narrative: STAND: The Haiti Project is initiating a COVID safe, year-round rehabilitation clinic in Port-de- Paix. The clinic serves adults and children in one of the lowest income communities in Haiti, providing physical therapy, prosthetics, wound care, primary medical care and health education. During COVID, the clinicians provide care to northwestern Haiti by conducting socially responsible home visits, providing community education, as well as ensuring people have access to safe rehabilitative care.

mailing-address.narrative: 5129 se 115th ave Portland, OR 97266 United States
